member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager
member.summary: Manages the loading of plugins.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.GetInstance
member.summary: Retrieves a reference to the PluginManager singleton.
member.returns: A reference to the PluginManager.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.LoadPlugins
member.summary: Loads the plugins available to the application. These must be located in the application directory and must implement IQuickSharpPlugin.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.RegisterPlugins
member.summary: Registers the loaded plugins. RegisterPlugins checks the dependencies of each plugin making sure each one exists and adds each to list of registered plugins sorted into the correct loading order. Any unsatisfied dependency (either the dependency doesn't exist or is an insufficient version number) will cause a fatal error and the application will aborted.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.ActivatePlugins(QuickSharp.Core.MainForm)
member.summary: Activates the registered plugins. ActivatePlugins works through the list of registed plugins and calls the Activate method on each one passing a reference to the application main form.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.HavePlugin(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if a plugin has been registered.
member.returns: True if the plugin has been registered.

member.name: E:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.PluginPreActivate
member.summary: Raises the PluginPreActivate event. PreActivation handlers can be registered to perform tasks before any plugins are activated. As plugins aren't active until the activation phase PreActivation tasks can only be registered by non-plugin application code, typically the application driver.

member.name: E:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.PluginPostActivate
member.summary: Raises the PluginPostActivate event. PostActivation handlers can be registered to perform post activation tasks. Plugins can register handlers during their activation phase. Typically this is used where a plugin needs to wait until all the plugins have loaded before performing some task.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.PluginManager.RegisteredPlugins
member.summary: Stores a list of the registered plugins.

member.param: The exception to display in the form.

The key is used to locate theme-specific locations (such as sub-folders) allowing the theme to provide it's own resources for various application features. member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.UserContent
member.summary: Deploys user data items to the user's application data folder on first-time startup. The items are stored within a subfolder of the common user data area within the application installation directory. The common area is named 'User' and contains subfolders containing files and folders that are to be copied to the user's local data folder the first time they run the application. The name of the subfolder is passed as a key to the DeployContent method.

member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.Document
member.summary: The base class for documents managed by the QuickSharp document management system. A document is a form used to present and manage data within the application. Document presentation is managed by the docking window system. Documents often represent files (but don't have to) and are created using new and open document handlers. Document operations are controlled by action and actionstate handlers.

member.name: F:QuickSharp.Core.Document.documentFileName
member.summary: The document's file name.

member.name: F:QuickSharp.Core.Document.documentFilePath
member.summary: The document's file path.

member.name: F:QuickSharp.Core.Document.documentTimeStamp
member.summary: The document's file timestamp.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.#ctor
member.summary: Create a new document.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.GetContent
member.summary: Get the document content. Override in derived classes to return the actual data content of the document.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.SetContent(System.Object)
member.summary: Set the document content. Override in derived classes to set the actual data content of the document.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.SetLocation(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Set a location within the document. Override in derived classes to set an actual location within the document.
member.param: The X coordinate of the location.
The Y coordinate of the location.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.AllowDuplicates
member.summary: Determine if the document type allows multiple loading of the same document. This is false by default.
member.returns: True if multiple loading is allowed.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.GetPersistString
member.summary: Get a string representing the document for storing in the docking window manager configuration file. Override in derived classes as required. This defaults to the file path of the document. Return an empty string to prevent the document from being reloaded at the start of a new session.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.RegisterActionStateHandler(System.String,QuickSharp.Core.ActionStateHandler)
member.summary: Register an ActionState handler for the document. ActionState handlers allow a document to register callback methods with document management system. Each callback responds to a particular action available from a MainForm UI element (menu and toolbar). When a document becomes active the document manager calls each method registered for that document to determine the state of each available UI element. If the callback returns false or no callback has been registered the corresponding UI element will be disabled.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.RegisterActionHandler(System.String,QuickSharp.Core.ActionHandler)
member.summary: Register an Action handler for the document. Action handlers allow callback methods to be associated with the UI elements in the MainForm. If a callback is available for a particular action when the document is active, invoking the action will invoke the callback.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.IsMenuItemEnabled(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem)
member.summary: Determine if a menu item is enabled. This uses the registered ActionState handlers to determine if the menu item should be enabled when the document is active.
member.returns: True if the menu is enabled.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.IsToolbarButtonEnabled(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton)
member.summary: Determine if a toolbar button is enabled. This uses the registered ActionState handlers to determine if the button should be enabled when the document is active.
member.returns: True if the button is enabled.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.IsActionEnabled(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if an action should be enabled.
member.returns: True if the action should be enabled. False if not or the action doesn't exist.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.PerformMenuAction(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripMenuItem)
member.summary: Perform the action associated with the menu item for the current document.
member.returns: The result of the action or true if it doesn't exist (cannot fail to perfom something it can't do).

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.PerformToolbarAction(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton)
member.summary: Perform the action associated with the toolbar button for the current document.
member.returns: The result of the action or true if it doesn't exist (cannot fail to perfom something it can't do).

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.Document.PerformAction(System.String)
member.summary: Perform the specified action.
member.returns: The result of the action or true if it doesn't exist (cannot fail to perfom something it can't do).

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.Document.FileName
member.summary: The document filename.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.Document.FilePath
member.summary: The document file path. This is null for an unsaved document.

member.summary: The latest saved time of the document.

member.summary: Get a menu item by name. This provides access to all the menu items present in the application main menu.

member.returns: The menu item or null if not found.

member.summary: Determine if a menu item is enabled for the active document. Calls the document's ActionState handler to determine the menu state.
member.param: The name of the menu item.
member.returns: True if the menu is enabled. False if not or if there is no active document.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.MainForm.IsToolbarButtonEnabled(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStripButton)
member.summary: Determine if a toolbar button is enabled for the active document. Calls the document's ActionState handler to determine the button state.
member.returns: True if the button is enabled. False if not or if there is no active document.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.MainForm.HaveDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if a file with the specified path has been loaded into a document.
member.returns: True if the document has been loaded.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.MainForm.LoadDocumentIntoWindow(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Call LoadDocument with the specified path and display the loaded file in a document window. Can optionally add the loaded file path to the most recently used (MRU) file list (if enabled).
member.returns: True if the document is loaded successfully.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.MainForm.LoadDocument(System.String)
member.summary: Loads a document from the specified path. This performs several steps in the following order. The path is converted to a DocumentType. Next, each of the registered document preload handlers is called, if any return false the load is cancelled. The document type is used to retrieve the open document handler registered for that type and the handler is used to open the document. If no handler is available the document is (otionally) passed to the Windows shell to be opened externally. If this fails the unknown document handler is retrieved and used to open the document. If this is not available an optional message is shown and the load fails.
member.returns: The loaded document.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.MainForm.AddDockedToolStrip(System.Windows.Forms.ToolStrip,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Add a toolbar to the toolbar panel. The initial location is determined by the row and column hints. Note the hints are just that: there is no guarantee that the specified row or column will be available. The actual row and column positions will be determined by the number of toolbars in the toolbar panel.
member.param: The row the toolbar should initially appear on.
The 'column' the toolbar should intially appear on. The column is determined by the number of toolbars on a row; the higher the hint the more to the right the toolbar will appear.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.MainForm.GetDockedToolStrip(System.String)
member.summary: Get a reference to a toolbar in the toolbar panel.
member.returns: A reference to the toolbar or null if the name is not found.

member.summary: Display a text message in the status bar message area.

member.summary: Display a temporary text message in the status bar message area. The message is cleared after the specified time period.

member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.PluginModule

member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.Plugin
member.summary: Contains metadata for describing plugins. This class is used to represent plugins inside the plugin management system, it is not the base class for plugins which are simply required to implement IQuickSharpPlugin. The Plugin class is used to represent plugin dependencies and is the base class for PluginModule which represents actual plugins.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.Plugin.ID
member.summary: The plugin ID. This must be a unique identifier and is usually a GUID.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.Plugin.Name
member.summary: The plugin name. This is a short title and is used to provide a human readable identity for the plugin. The name is for information purposes only.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.Plugin.Version
member.summary: The version of the plugin. The version identifies a particular revision of a plugin and is only required if the functional interace of a plugin changes. The version is mainly intended to allow downstream plugins to indicate a minimum version of the plugin they require.

member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.RegistryPersistenceManager
member.summary: Implements IPersistenceManager providing a Windows registry-based persistence manager. Application settings are stored in the registry under an application-specific key located at "HKEY\CURRENT_USER\Software". Individual instances of the persistence manager use a sub-key to store settings within the main application hive providing a simple namespacing system for the application plugins.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.MenuTools.CreateMenuItem(System.String,System.String,System.Drawing.Image,System.Windows.Forms.Keys,System.String,System.EventHandler,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Create a menu item and a trailing separator. The separator is only created as a flag on the menu item, the actual separator is created once all the menu items have been loaded. A separator should be included after each group of related menu items. If a separator is inserted at the last position in a menu it will automatically be deleted if no menu items follow.
member.param: A text representation of the menu item shortcut keys if the keys are defined elsewhere.
The menu item's click event handler.
If true insert a separator after the menu item.
member.returns: The menu item.

member.summary: Create a toolbar button with a leading separator. The separator is only created as a flag on the button, the actual separator is inserted after the entire toolbar has been assembled. The first item in a group of buttons should include a separator.
member.param: The tooltip text for the button.
If true insert a separator before the button.
member.returns: The button.

member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.ApplicationStorage
member.summary: Provides a general-purpose, application-wide object store. Used to provide a means for plugins to share data without requiring explicit dependencies between them. Objects are stored using text keys. Care must be taken with key management: keys need to be defined consistently wherever the data is accessed but because of the possibility that the provider and consumer might not have a direct dependency it will not allways be possible to use shared string constants to define the keys.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ApplicationStorage.GetInstance
member.summary: Retrieves a reference to the ApplicationStorage singleton.
member.returns: A reference to the ApplicationStorage singleton.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ApplicationStorage.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Add an item to the store. Duplicate items are overwitten. Does nothing if the key is empty of null.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ApplicationStorage.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Add an item to the store. Optionally throw System.ArgumentException if the key already exists or System.ArgumentNullException if the key is null.
member.param: Throw exception if key is nul or already exists.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ApplicationStorage.Get(System.String)
member.summary: Get an item from the store using the specified key.
member.returns: The item or null if the key is null, empty or not found.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ApplicationStorage.Get(System.String,System.Type)
member.summary: Get an item from the store using the specified key. The item is created if it doesn't exist.
member.returns: The item or null if the key is empty or null.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ApplicationStorage.Item(System.String)
member.summary: Gets or sets an item using the specified key. Duplicate items are overwitten.
member.returns: The value or null if the key is null, empty or not found.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.FileTools.ReadFile(System.String,System.Text.Encoding@)
member.summary: Read a text file and returns its content and encoding. The encoding is determined using byte order marks (BOM) and defaults to ASCII if a BOM is not found or a problem occurs reading the file. Supported encodings are ASCII, UTF-8, UTF-16 BE and UTF-16 LE.
member.param: The path of the file to read.
member.returns: The content of the file.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.FileTools.GetEncoding(System.String)
member.summary: Open a text file and return its encoding. The encoding is determined using byte order marks (BOM) and defaults to ASCII if a BOM is not found or a problem occurs reading the file. Supported encodings are ASCII, UTF-8, UTF-16 BE and UTF-16 LE.
member.returns: The file's encoding.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.FileTools.WriteFile(System.String,System.String,System.Text.Encoding)
member.summary: Write text to a text file. A new file is always created and the text is written using the specified encoding.
member.param: The content to write to the file.

member.returns: True if the file is invalid.

member.returns: True if the specified time is older than the last write time of the file.

member.summary: Returns true if the DocumentType is empty, i.e. has no extension. An empty DocumentType is represented as ".".

member.summary: Performs a string comparison between two DocumentTypes. Returns 0 if they match.

member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile
member.summary: Provides properties and methods used to define customizable behaviour for a QuickSharp.Core application.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.#ctor
member.summary: ClientProfile constructor.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.AddFlag(System.String)
member.summary: Add a client flag to the application. Client flags allow arbitrary text values to be made available for reading anywhere in the application. Typically they are used to provide customised behaviour in plugins. Flags should be specified as simple text values not constants; it is important that no dependencies be created between the application driver and any plugin reading the flags.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.HaveFlag(System.String)
member.summary: Determine if a client flag is present.

member.name: M:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.SetUICultureFromCommandLine(System.String[])
member.summary: Set the current UI culture from a command line switch. The culture should be specified using this example format: "/uiculture:en-AU".

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.ClientName
member.summary: The name of the client application. Provides a simple name available for naming application resources. Used to define the name of the local user data directory.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.ClientTitle
member.summary: The title of the client application. Provides a display name for the application. Used in the main form and about box title bars.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.ClientIcon
member.summary: The icon used in the application main form.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.CopyrightText
member.summary: Application-specific copyright information presented in the about box.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.AboutBoxImage
member.summary: The background image used for the about box.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.AboutBoxTextColor
member.summary: The color of the text used in the about box.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.UpdateCheckURL
member.summary: The URL for the update check. The update check feature is disabled if this is null. The URL is the file retrieved when 'Check for updates' is clicked and should consist of a text file containing the latest application version number on a single line.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.UpdateHomeURL
member.summary: The URL for the link presented in the update check form. The link is not presented if this is null.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.UpdateLinkText
member.summary: The text for the link presented in the update check form. The link is not presented if this is null.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.MRUDocumentListMax
member.summary: The maximum number of files listed in the MRU documents list. Defaults to 9. Set to 0 to disable the MRU list.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.HelpFileName
member.summary: The application help file. This is presented on the main form Help menu and is opened using the Windows shell when the help menu item is clicked. The file name should be a resource that can be opened directly such as a text, chm or html file. The help menu item will be hidden if this value is null or empty.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.HelpFileTitle
member.summary: The text of the menu item presented in the Help menu if the help file is available. The help menu item will be hidden if this is null or empty.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.HelpShortcutKeys
member.summary: Optional shortcut keys used to access the help menu item.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.HelpMenuImage
member.summary: Optional image to be used for the help menu item.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.PersistenceProvider
member.summary: The persistence provider used for the application.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.PersistenceKey
member.summary: The text key to be associated with the persistence manager.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.CommandLineArgs
member.summary: The command line arguments passed to the application at startup.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.CurrentUICulture
member.summary: The UI culture presented by the application. Defaults to the CurrentUICulture of the current thread.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.DisableUserHome
member.summary: Set to false to disable the use of local user data folders. All user-specific content will be located in the application home directory.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.UpdateCheckFormFactory
member.summary: Factory handler used to provide the UpdateCheck form. By default this uses the built-in update check form. Provide a custom factory handler to use an alternative update check form.

member.name: P:QuickSharp.Core.ClientProfile.AboutBoxFactory
member.summary: Factory handler used to provide the About form. By default this uses the built-in about form. Provide a custom factory handler to use an alternative about box.

member.name: T:QuickSharp.Core.ThemeFlags
member.summary: Presents theme properties for use throughout the application. Rather than directly manipulate plugin UI elements to enforce theme colors this presents the values for plugins to read if available. Like ClientFlags this allows settings to be communicated to plugins without having to create dependencies between them.
